meanings.definition: A device for generating high-frequency electrical currents.
meanings.sent1: The dynatron hummed softly as it produced the electrical currents.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the dynatron to create high-frequency waves for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The dynatron decided to throw a party and invited all the other electrical devices.
meanings.sent4: Her voice cut through the room like a dynatron, commanding attention effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dynatron sparkled with energy, illuminating the entire laboratory.

meanings.definition: A type of vacuum tube used in early radio transmitters.
meanings.sent1: The old radio crackled to life thanks to the dynatron inside.
meanings.sent2: The engineer carefully replaced the worn dynatron in the transmitter.
meanings.sent3: The dynatron tube told jokes to the other radio parts, making them all laugh.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed smoothly, like music from a dynatron, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The dynatron glowed warmly, sending signals across the airwaves.

meanings.definition: A brand name for a type of electronic component.
meanings.sent1: She purchased a new dynatron for her electronic project.
meanings.sent2: The store had a sale on dynatrons, so he stocked up on them.
meanings.sent3: The dynatron component danced around happily in the circuit board.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a dynatron, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The dynatron clicked into place, completing the electronic device.
